title: Member of Technical Staff - Opportunity for Working Remotely...
description:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?

You have an analytical mind and a passion for the craft of software engineering, and you love solving problems and learning new things. You want to be a part of a collaborative environment whose teams care about the product they are creating, how they create it, and the impact it has on customers’ business objectives. You want to help build the DevSecOps story for the Tanzu Application Platform (TAP), and specifically, you’re interested in working on Cartographer, an open source project which allows you to create secure and reusable supply chains that define all of your application CI and CD in one place, in cluster.

You might like working with us if you:

  • Like working as a part of an empowered balanced team.

  • Believe in Outcomes over Output.

  • Prioritize equitable treatment, inclusivity, and diversity.

  • Work with empathy and kindness.

  • Believe in doing the right thing, and doing what works.

Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?

  • 30d - You have become immersed in the team’s day to day operations. You have reviewed the team’s code base (primarily Go and YAML) and have started participating in code reviews.

  • 90d - You have become familiar with the team’s technical domain and have begun using that knowledge to advise and influence cross-team, customer and Open Source collaborations.

  • 180d - You are advising junior engineers on how to advance technical workstreams, focusing mainly on the team’s codebase. You will lead the team in troubleshooting and mitigating high severity issues.

  • 360d - You have reviewed and contributed to the team’s architecture/design artifacts and decisions.

The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

  • 30d - You understand Kubernetes, the DevSecOps space, and have working knowledge of the components, technology stack, and deployment pipeline of your project.

  • 90d - You are guiding the team through all phases of the development process, collaborating with key stakeholders cross-functionally to turn customer requirements into product features. You are mentoring team members at different stages in their technical career. Giving feedback to help team members grow.

  • 180d - You are an opinionated member of the engineering team, able to navigate all aspects of the software development lifecycle and advocate for changes as needed. You are improving our team's code quality, efficiency, and processes, introducing new tools, and evaluating team metrics.

  • 360d – You are leading initiatives, creating the team’s technical design documentation and architectural decisions, and coordinating with other members of technical leadership across TAP. You are advising and setting the team’s technical direction by exploring and implementing new features for TAP.


What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?

The DevSecOps Team is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are a learning organization and believe that diverse teams are stronger and more effective at solving problems. Empathy and diverse points of view, approaches, and skill sets bring us to the best solution faster, together.


What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?

You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.

  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan

  • Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types

  • Generous Time Off Programs

  • 40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community

  • Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities

  • Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, training, course work, etc.)

  • Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes

title: Product Designer
description:
Bonfire is looking for a Product Designer who shares our belief that UX is a science and changing people’s behaviour is the measurable target outcome. Working directly with Product, UX, and our delivery teams, you will be accountable for these changes in behaviour.

We’ve already differentiated ourselves in the market with great UX, and now we’re looking for a Product Designer to bring us to the next level. With a focus on design system strategy, information architecture, and user journey mapping, you’ll become our master cartographer, supporting the ProdUX team & Bonfire in achieving our vision of creating the ultimate ‘ease-of-use’ system, delighting our users by seamlessly guiding them towards achieving all their jobs to be done.

Reporting to and collaborating extensively with the Director, Product, your role will take on core strategic meaning as we leverage design system & information architecture to guide and support Bonfire’s users through the complex world of procurement and sourcing. Deep knowledge of the personas we serve will be critical for you to achieve lasting success in this role, and a key component of your ability to lead diffusively throughout Bonfire.

You will live and thrive in MIRO, FIGMA and other visual tools to facilitate internal collaboration & external discovery, and to create artifacts that contribute to the ProdUX team’s responsibility to determine “what we build and why we build it.”

Overall, this role will have a wide swimlane, with boundaries defined by the larger product & organizational strategy. The scope of this role will demand you apply your skills from the full range of the Design Practice spectrum.

What You'll Do:
  • Take Action: Thoughtfully and collaboratively make informed quick decisions. You are willing and able to roll up your sleeves.
  • Be a Leader: Make others better around you. Coach and nurture a high-performance team
  • Design Strategically: You can build & implement a design strategy that delights users
  • Mapping, Mapping, Mapping: Through experience mapping, journey mapping, and empathy mapping, you’ll create visual artifacts that lead to great prioritization decisions and great outcomes for the customer. Help others make connections, build consensus, and define the things that actually matter.
  • Research & Discover: Maintain a laser focus on ‘making something people want’, by leading Discovery and Validation campaigns with customers. Rapidly produce multiple design concepts, knowing when to produce low fidelity sketches, prototypes, or pixel perfect mockups.
  • UX & UI Design: Support the production of design prototypes for delivery teams, showing how a user will experience your solution.
  • Crush Your Goals: Ship, measure, and improve your designs based on quantitative and qualitative feedback. Own micro-interaction level metrics, and align the success of your designs to Product & strategic objectives
Who You Are:
Education & Experience:
  • You make maps: Your maps have been the basis for the execution of long-term strategy over 4+ years experience as a designer in a SaaS environment.
  • You’re already a subject matter expert: You have direct experience designing products for Procurement, Legal, Compliance, or related professionals.
  • Your experiences have made measurable and meaningful impacts: You are data-driven, with a track record of leveraging behavioral metrics to define and iteratively achieve success.
  • You’re smart: You have a University degree or related hands-on experience.
Skills:
  • You’re a facilitator and collaborator, with a deep belief that “it doesn’t exist unless I write it down and show it to someone for feedback. You have track record of successfully building relationships with customers and identifying their needs and providing solutions for them…You are a champion for collaborative, iterative product discovery and delivery…Exceptional visual communication skills, to produce meaningful artifacts for stakeholders…You’re experienced in planning and executing user research and discovery campaigns…You can produce meaningful feedback to stakeholders and make recommendations.
  • You care about the details: Experience working with Design Systems and how they impact the success of our front end development. You produce dev-ready UI/UX designs. You are able to rapidly produce multiple concepts and prototypes; knowing when to apply pixel-perfect attention to detail, and when to make low-fi sketches and prototypes to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.
  • You can multitask: You’re able to easily switch between customer conversation and technical discussions, translating core requirements to each internal stakeholder in their own language
  • You are relatable: You build strong internal and external relationships.
  • You’re a good person: You demonstrate passion and energy for every product you’ve worked on and for the teams you’ve worked with… you understand at a deep level that we’re all in it together…you’re humble, nice, and yet direct and straightforward.
Please include samples of work or a link to a portfolio to be considered.

Core Competencies: Visual Thinking, Facilitation, UI Design, UX Design, Leadership, Empathy, Strategic Thinking, Analytical Thinking, Problem Solving Mindset, Initiative, Decision Making

Working conditions (if applicable)
  • Local travel may be required for customer visits, research initiatives and industry events.
  • Occasionally you may be required to assist on product launches or updates that occur outside normal office hours.
  • Applicants from across Canada are encouraged to apply with the understanding that Bonfire operates by Eastern Standard Time.
Why Bonfire?
Bonfire offers numerous perks to its employees, including the opportunity to:
  • Live well. We offer a Personal Spending Account that you can use for anything related to active, healthy, or well-rounded living. This has been adjusted to also include any Home Office related purchases!
  • Stay Limber. Flexibility is a high priority at Bonfire, from working hours, to work arrangements, to vacation!
  • Take a vacation (or many). Bonfire offers a flexible vacation policy. That means you’ll have a guaranteed annual vacation allowance, plus anything additional that you can arrange with your manager.
  • Recharge and take care. Bonfire offers recharge days and paid personal leave days so our employees can recharge, relax, and take care of themselves.
  • Donate your time. Bonfire offers employees paid philanthropy days that can be used to do volunteer or philanthropic work individually or with your team.
  • Develop yourself. We want to support your career growth, so on top of a generous Professional Development program, we establish opportunities for promotions and job changes for employees to learn and grow internally.
  • Celebrate at every occasion. Bonfire’s Culture Curators make sure that our team’s culture is bustling, with frequent fun events to cover all holidays and special occasions, as well as for miscellaneous fun.
  • Values you can get behind:
  • You will work with those who move mountains to help others win
  • You will be part of a company where employees share their knowledge and resources, work hard and have fun
  • You will work with colleagues who work smart to spend their scarce time and resources to identify and exploit the levers that produce the greatest impact
  • You will work with others who enjoy the work, constantly learn, leverage tools, and take pride in their output
  • You will join a team who commits to the mission, take risks, and celebrate all wins throughout the journey
Who is Bonfire?
At Bonfire, we bring Buyers and Vendors together to make decisions with certainty. We're a leader in strategic sourcing and procurement technology and enable organizations to make the right purchasing decisions. We've powered over $33-billion dollars-worth of decision making across 500+ customers who have a 99% adoption rate and have ranked us with a 78 NPS score (that's Netflix and Apple territory!).

First, we graduated as a Y-combinator success, then became a VC-backed startup, and now through the 2019 acquisition, we're excited to be a part of the largest government technology company in the industry, GTY Technology Holdings. Bonfire is an opportunity for you to build something amazing while accelerating your career.

Follow us on Instagram @go.bonfire to see more of #LifeatBonfire.

Please apply for this role via Linkedin EasyApply: (https://bit.ly/3wDfwst).

Bonfire is committed to the integration of accessibility legislation with our policies, procedures, programs, and training, to be reviewed as practices, procedures, or regulations change. title: P2 -GIS Specialist
description:
Do you have experience working as a GIS Analyst? Have you previously worked with SpatialNET or a similar product? If so, this is a perfect opportunity for you working with one of Canada's largest telecommunications companies!
Our client is looking for a GIS Specialist for a 12 months contract in Barrie. This position is working hybrid remote 3 days in office and 2 days remote.


Advantages
Start date is ASAP
Hybrid remote work
Long term contract
Competitive pay rate


Responsibilities
As a GIS Specialist, your duties will include but not be limited to:
•Tracing OTDR/CD/PMD, loss measurements and other fibre characterization specifications.
•Performing analysis of and recommendations for different fibre network technical options.
•Preparing fibre cost estimates (FERs) and produce CAs, BOM and POs for fibre national or inter regional projects. Coordinate spending and timelines. Ensure projected overruns are escalated in timely fashion.
•Planning and provides liaison to fiber users with client Wireless and other 3rd parties for fiber allocation and IRUs.
•Providing input to engineering plans for fibre network expansions/upgrades in a timely manner to allow implementation to be within specification, on time and within budget.
•Assisting in ensuring engineering plans meet fibre network needs in terms of reliability and capacity, and ensure the Fibre Network is built for ease of use from an operations perspective. •Assisting in providing documents that assist other departments eg RFQ for implementation
•Providing engineering support for the selection of routes to ensure optimum cost effectiveness and performance, and in the preparation of construction and permit drawings and bill of materials for new plant and forced projects.
•Providing engineering support for the operation, maintenance and restoration of the fibre network.
•Participating as lead for certain phases of complex fibre network projects.
•Providing input for the preparation for technical presentations and proposals on the client Fibre Network.
•Providing input or advice related to fibre network technical issues.


Qualifications
Qualifications:
•Must have full knowledge of SpatialNET RF/Fibre/ISP Design and As-built input knowledge with data trouble shooting experience. In-depth SpatialNET Fibre Splicing knowledge will be an asset.
•Ability to investigate and resolve record discrepancies related to SpatialNET. GIS data as identifying in various OSS and SAM reports.
•Management of the client Fibre Network. Fibre circuit assignments, fibre records management and fibre network documentation including fibre IRU records, splice logs, fiber counts and availability, loopback, splice and coupler locations, termination cabinets and panel locations,
•Provide fibre network design alternatives and assist in optimizing fibre network capital and operating costs.
•Provide engineering support for the client Fibre Network and the implementation of new engineering plans.
•Accurately document details of client Fibre Network topology.
•Three to Five years of Network engineering and Planning experience.
-In depth knowledge of AutoCAD

Nice to Haves:
•Customer Service Orientation, Teamwork and Collaboration, Adaptability and Initiative.
•Experience with a major Telecom Service Provider or Cable Operator and direct involvement in building large fibre networks.
•Education experience should include undergraduate university degree or College Diploma in electrical engineering, Telecoms Engineering or equivalent PE, CET , SCTE, BCE, BCT, or BTS certification/designation is definitely and asset.
•Excellent organizational, written and verbal skills.
•Ability to work within a dynamic team and organize time among multiple tasks.
•Communicates effectively with both technical and operations management
•Ability to prepare information and advise internal and external customers on proposed ideas, products or solutions.
-MS Office suite (excel, access, outlook)
-RPATS knowledge
-Google Earth

title: GIS Manager
description:
Join the Canacre team in an exciting role working on leading edge infrastructure projects.  

We are technical experts in land, energy, and transportation development delivering accurate, innovative, and agile solutions to our partners. We provide land acquisition, geospatial mapping, data management, web-based GIS, community relations, land feasibility studies, and permitting services. Canacreâ€™s clients include developers, large scale service providers, and government entities that are involved in the planning and development of energy projects, rights of way, resources, and infrastructure across Canada and the United States. Canacre works on large-scale wind and solar power projects, high-voltage transmission lines, pipeline projects, municipal roads projects, and groupings of cellular towers and rooftop antennas.  

The Manager, GIS Services leads the GIS team and focuses on GIS analysis, manages incoming and outgoing data, creates professional looking map products and reports for distribution to internal and external parties.

In addition, your role will be to:

  • Manage Direct Reports and establish annual goals.
  • Build, lead and empower a diverse and capable team.
  • Cultivate a work environment committed to the health, safety and wellness of employees.
  • Establish a highly efficient and positive culture where employees are empowered and accountable for areas of responsibility.
  • Oversee and manage GIS Specialists and Team Leads on project related initiatives.
  • Develop high quality custom maps and reports.
  • Plan, design and oversee geographic information system (GIS) projects.
  • Coordinate use of GIS Data within the GIS team.
  • Design, implement and maintain databases and applications to support a variety of projects.
  • Trains users in GIS software, spatial analysis and related technologies.
  • Create GIS training exercises and reference documents.
  • Design data standards, report and mapping templates.
  • Convert data and conduct GIS analysis.
  • Address and resolve issues relating to project and/or data.
  • Manage internal and external project data.
  • Design, oversee and conduct Quality Assurance and Quality Control (QA/QC) procedures on mapping and data products.
  • Conduct evaluations of cartographic and GIS principles.
  • Identify mapping requirements.
  • Approve reports and provide client related updates to management.  
  • Create, edit and manage data for a variety of projects.
  • Perform data analysis and spatial queries.
  • Set up internal GIS system including field data collection capabilities and in-house data management systems.
  • Provide drawings, data and geographic information for various projects and reports.
  • Create, analyse and maintain vector, raster and tabular data and databases.
  • Liaise with clients providing solutions, reports and updates.
  • Liaise with Canacre teams on related projects.
  • Liaise with Field Team and Project Managers to deliver quality products.

Qualifications:

  • Post secondary degree in GIS, Cartography, Geography, Civil Engineering, or related field of study, or equivalent experience.
  • Minimum 5 years professional experience in GIS.
  • Minimum 2 yearsâ€™ experience in a management position.
  • Working experience with running project quality control.
  • Working experience in a management or supervisory position.
  • Educational or Professional experience with ESRI ArcGIS and its extensions.
  • Working knowledge of digitizing, editing, performing queries and creating maps in ArcGIS, Microsoft Access DB & Reporting Tools, Microsoft Excel AutoCAD and relational databases.
  • SQL/VBA language skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • A keen attention to detail.
  • An understanding of various GIS data formats, map projections and how to integrate AutoCAD and GIS data.

Other benefits include a RRSP employer matching program, discounted Goodlife corporate membership, flexible work arrangement and a variety of wellness programs.

Given the volume of applications we typically receive, we are unable to respond to all applicants, however, you will be contacted if your experience is a suitable match. No phone calls please.

About Our Organization:

When you join the City of Guelph, you join a team of 2000 full and part-time employees who deliver services the community relies on every day. Together, we are bringing to life Guelphâ€™s vision of an inclusive, connected, and prosperous city where we look after each other and our environment.

 

As a regional top employer, the City of Guelph values its employees and offers competitive salaries, excellent benefit packages, opportunities for professional development, a healthy work-life balance, and many roles with flexible work options. Our corporate values are integrity, service, inclusion, wellness, and learning. Guelph is consistently ranked as one of the best places in Canada to live, work, and playâ€”all good reasons to consider a career in this beautiful city.

Job Summary:

Resumes are being accepted for the temporary (1 year contract) position of GIS Analyst within the Information Technology department. Geographic Information Systems (GIS) is based within the Information Technology Department of Corporate Services. The mandate of GIS services is to provide leadership and support to City departments enabling them to provide better service to the public through GIS technology services and innovation. The GIS Analyst role will assist in the implementation of key GIS initiatives at the City of Guelph. The successful candidate will analyze current business processes and form an integral part of a team that re-engineers these processes to gain efficiencies and best utilize technologies.The successful candidate will perform all aspects of business analysis of GIS and related systems with a focus on quality customer service and continuous improvement processes.Guided by the goals and objectives of the City of Guelph Corporate Strategic Plan and committed to the Corporate Values of integrity, service, inclusion, wellness and learning, the candidate will aid in the achievement of the Community Vision for an inclusive, connected, prosperous city.

 

Your role

 

  • Collaboratively evolve large corporate spatial databases and applications to serve City requirements.
  • Develop-re-engineer GIS related policies, standards, procedures and strategies.  
  • Responsible for spatial analysis and interpretation on specific projects.
  • Maintain customized and third-party spatial applications and add-ons.
  • Manage GIS-related integrated systems projects.
  • Manage requirements with appropriate change management techniques, revision maintenance, security and overall system infrastructure.
  • Utilize industry best practices to ensure business continuity and continual improvement of corporate information systems.
  • Analyze and/or administer application interfaces, convert spatial data to different formats when required.
  • Work with other Business System Analysts to document, re-engineer and implement streamlined business processes and optimize corporate workflow.
  • Work in conjunction with other technical staff to isolate, troubleshoot, resolve problems and administer corporate applications.
  • Provide leadership and guidance to team members.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

 

Qualifications

  • Considerable experience related to the duties listed above, normally acquired through the completion of a university degree in Computer Science, Business, Geomatics, GIS Environmental Management or a related discipline and considerable experience supporting GIS and related systems in a medium to large sized corporate environment, preferably in a municipal setting. Candidates with an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
  • Experience working with ESRIâ€™s ArcGIS software suite (ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online)
  • Familiarity with FME from Safe Software for ETL processing.
  • Experience working with Oracle and SQL Server databases.
  • Experience in business analysis, business process re-engineering and managing IT related projects.
  • Experience in interface support, design, analysis and programming.
  • Must possess a valid class G driversâ€™ licence with a good driving record and access to a vehicle.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate with all levels of staff, stakeholders and external vendors.
  • Ability to manage a workload where priorities are constantly changing and work in an environment with a high rate of technological change.
  • Knowledge of land information requirements, field data collection systems and relevant municipal processes and policies.
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (e.g. Word, Excel, Power Point and Access) and Microsoft Project Management software.
  • A firm understanding of database, networking and system administration concepts.
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills.
  • Excellent customer and client support skills with the ability to work independently and within a team environment.
  • Certified geographic information systems professional (GISP) designation would be considered an asset.
  • Experience in the use of Eclipse PPM or other project management software would be an asset.

In accordance with the City of Guelphâ€™s employment practices, new employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire, subject to accommodations required in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code.

 

Rate

$87,200 - $109,000

How to apply

Qualified applicants are invited to apply using our online application system by Sunday, May 29, 2022. Please note all applicants must complete the online questionnaire specific to this position at the time they submit their resume and cover letter in order to be considered. Proof of qualifications will be requested at the interview stage.

 

The City of Guelph is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. We are therefore happy to accommodate any individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require an accommodation in order to participate in the hiring process, please contact us to make your needs known in advance.

 

Personal information collected through the recruitment process will be used solely to determine eligibility for employment. We thank all candidates in advance; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

title: Technician
description:
POSITION TITLE:

TECHNICIAN

INTERNAL CLOSING DATE:

 April 28, 2022

LOCATIONS:

Crossroads

3-1581 Regent Ave. West

CLASSIFICATION:

4 Month Part Time Term

DEPARTMENT:

Laboratory Health Services Centre

COMPENSATION:

As per Collective Agreement

WORKING SCHEDULE:

Monday – Friday 7:30am-12:00pm

(22.5 hours per week)

 

 

 

Job Summary
As a Technician, you will be responsible for obtaining quality blood samples and other specimens from patients, as well as conducting other patient tests, all in keeping with Dynacare’s mission and values. Working as part of a team, you will assist in building a positive team environment, maintaining quality metrics and creating the ideal customer experience.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Performs a variety of routine laboratory procedures to obtain data for use in the diagnosis and treatment of disease. 

 

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • Obtains venous and capillary blood specimens.
  • Performs all routine procedures, such as urine collections, specimen preparations.
  • Follows all guidelines for handling of infectious materials.
  • Maintains accurate records for all test and control results.
  • Prepares QC statistical reports on monthly basis.
  • Performs routine equipment maintenance and calibrations.
  • Required to observe all safety precautions in the performance of all duties.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

SKILLED KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS:

Knowledge

  • Graduate of a Laboratory Technician program or equivalent previous experience.
  • Medical terminology an asset.

Technical Skills

  • Experience with phlebotomy.

Social Processing Skills

  • Ability to multitask and work in a team environment.
  • Attention to detail and organizational skills are essential.
  • Ability to function in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Excellent communication skills.

 

***Please refer to Article 2 and 7 of the Collective Agreement regarding temporary positions, job postings, promotions and transfers***

title: Spécialiste - Intégrateur de solutions géospatiales
description:
Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise et l’Amérique du Nord. Intégrez notre équipe Services informatiques et de la technologie (I et T), un élément essentiel du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l’architecture d’entreprise aux technologies opérationnelles, nos équipes font appel à la méthodologie Agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer pour assurer l’optimisation et la sécurité de nos activités et permettre à notre personnel de se consacrer à des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez approfondir vos compétences et bâtir votre carrière dans notre culture tissée serrée et axée sur la sécurité, où nous travaillons ensemble comme UNE ÉQUIPE. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

 

Résumé des fonctions

Dans le cadre de projets complexes comprenant plusieurs domaines de solution, ainsi que des technologies et des composants majeurs, la personne titulaire de ce poste est responsable de la conception et de l’intégration globales de bout en bout de la solution géospatiale. Selon la quantité de composants techniques ou fonctionnels, nous aurons recours à seulement un intégrateur ou une intégratrice de solution, ou à seulement un intégrateur ou une intégratrice technique, ou encore aux deux, et dans ce cas, ceux-ci travailleront de concert pour fournir la solution complète. L’intégrateur ou l’intégratrice Solution géospatiale participe au processus depuis la phase d’évaluation et de planification jusqu’à la stabilisation. La personne qui occupe ce poste doit comprendre tous les points d’intégration et leur incidence sur les activités d’essai, de mise en œuvre et de stabilisation. Cette personne agit à titre de facilitateur entre les différents postes (concepteur fonctionnel, administrateur Systèmes, analyste commercial, directeur de projet, etc.). Le ou la titulaire de ce poste est le lien entre tous les membres d’une équipe chargée d’un projet complexe et à plusieurs volets. Ce poste s’inscrit dans le cadre du soutien géospatial de plusieurs composants déjà fournis; la personne qui l’occupe doit s’adapter et réagir rapidement afin de contribuer au dépannage (conformément aux multiples documents fournis) et aborde un large éventail de capacités SIG.

Le ou la titulaire du poste doit également vérifier les saisies de données dans le SIG effectuées par différents groupes commerciaux et fournisseurs externes en gérant les données géospatiales dans le modèle de données SIG de l’entreprise. Cette personne est également responsable de la qualité et de l’intégrité des données de tous les documents produits suivant la logique métier dans le cadre de la gestion des données du réseau ferroviaire (RNDM – topologie dans le SIG).

 

Principales responsabilités

Conception de la solution géospatiale 

  • Offrir du soutien aux équipes Architecture et Gestion de projets et collaborer avec elles afin de définir une solution et d’élaborer un plan de haut niveau.

Gestion des données spatiales

  • Coordonner les activités d’essai des règles opérationnelles du SIG avec les chefs d’équipe et les équipes satellites
  • Faire des essais unitaires S’il y a lieu, se charger également des essais fonctionnels et des essais d’intégration, et préparer les scénarios, les cas types et les données d’essai
  • Favoriser, diffuser et appliquer les politiques fonctionnelles, les méthodes et les pratiques exemplaires en matière de qualité
  • Veiller à l’exactitude de tous les rapports géospatiaux envoyés aux différents groupes commerciaux.

Livraison de la solution géospatiale

  • Coordonner les activités de conception, d’élaboration et d’essai avec les divers chefs, les équipes satellites et les parties externes.

Coordination de la solution géospatiale 

  • Évaluer l’état de préparation de la solution et de l’environnement en vue d’une progression vers les divers stades de la livraison. Gérer les problèmes relatifs à la solution au cours de la livraison et les signaler à l’échelon supérieur.

 Conditions de travail

Ce poste prévoit des conditions de travail standard dans un bureau et un horaire de travail normal du lundi au vendredi. En raison de la nature du poste, la personne qui en est titulaire doit être en mesure de respecter des échéanciers serrés, de bien tolérer la pression et de gérer le stress.

 

Exigences

Expérience

  • Au moins 5 ans d’expérience des technologies FME et Oracle Spatial
  • Au moins 2 ans d’expérience avec les technologies ESRI (ARCGIS Pro, ARCGIS Server, ARCGIS Online)
  • Expérience d’au moins 2 ans en exploitation et en soutien de solutions SIG pour des chemins de fer ou dans le domaine du transport
  • Aptitudes pour l’analyse et la résolution de problèmes
  • Expérience de l’environnement et de la configuration technique SIG et capacité à concevoir, faire fonctionner et entretenir efficacement un système de gestion des actifs SIG
  • Capacité de concevoir et de tenir à jour un modèle de référence linéaire (LRM et LRS) et les fonctionnalités et concepts du SIG dans Oracle Spatial (par exemple, l’analyse des données géographiques et le système de référence linéaire)
  • Expérience en intégration de solutions logicielles conçues sur mesure pendant toute la durée de vie du projet (architecture, conception, élaboration, intégration, vérification, déploiement, soutien)
  • Capacité à communiquer sur les composants fonctionnels et techniques, à les documenter et à les comprendre facilement, à différents niveaux de détail (matériel informatique, logiciels, fonctionnels et non fonctionnels)
  • Expérience de la conformité aux systèmes standard et aux protocoles de sécurité des données
  • Capacité à évaluer et à utiliser, le cas échéant, l’infrastructure informatique existante

Formation, certification et désignation

  • Baccalauréat en géomatique, en géodésie ou en génie géomatique
  • Maîtrise en informatique, en systèmes d’information géographique (SIG) ou dans un domaine connexe, un atout
  • Certification en technologies FME et Oracle Spatial, un atout

Compétences

  • Communiquer de l’information et avoir un bon esprit de collaboration
  • Traiter les risques en temps opportun afin de les éliminer
  • Innover par la résolution de problèmes
  • Inspirer les autres par des communications efficaces et s’adapter à l’auditoire à l’oral et à l’écrit
  • Faire preuve de jugement dans la prise de décisions et prendre des décisions difficiles au moment opportun
  • Accorder la priorité au développement individuel et à l’apprentissage continu
  • Gérer la pression et les changements en restant calme pour s’adapter rapidement
  • Établir des relations avec les clients et fournir des services de grande valeur

Connaissances et compétences techniques

  • Expérience professionnelle des chemins de fer ou de l’Ingénierie et du Transport
  • Excellente connaissance du développement d’applications au moyen de Python

 

 

À propos du CN


Le CN est un chef de file mondial du transport et un partenaire commercial majeur. Essentiel pour l'économie, les clients et les communautés dans lesquelles il exerce ses activités, le CN transporte annuellement de façon sécuritaire plus de 300 millions de tonnes de ressources naturelles, de produits manufacturés et de produits finis partout en Amérique du Nord. Seul chemin de fer reliant les côtes est et ouest du Canada à la pointe sud des États-Unis avec un réseau ferroviaire de 19 500 milles, le CN et ses filiales contribuent à la prospérité des collectivités et au commerce durable depuis 1919. Le CN demeure engagé à soutenir des programmes supportant la responsabilité sociale et les initiatives de protection de l’environnement. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

 

Le CN exige que tous lesmembres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 etqu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat devaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales enpropriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents etfournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN auCanada.

Are you a trusted partner and a problem solver? If you enjoy entrepreneurship and innovation, this opportunity is for you! As someone with excellent communication skills and business acumen, you will thrive in our fast-paced and agile environment.

 

Your opportunity

 

We are currently seeking candidates for the position of a GIS Analyst, in our Fredericton or Saint John office. You will be a member of Dillonâ€™s Spatial Information Management team within the Planning and Design group, which comprises policy, physical and development planners, urban designers, landscape architects, graphic artists and transportation & transit planners located in our offices across Canada.   2. Collaborate with multidisciplinary project teams including, planners, engineers, scientists, and technologists    
  3. Provide support in the development of reports and presentations for multidisciplinary projects, client meetings, and proposals
  4. Contribute to the development and management of existing and innovative technical systems, standards and procedures to maintain high standards of efficiency and quality in products and services
  5. Attend client meetings and conducting field work upon request
  6. Business travel to other Dillon offices upon request
Qualifications:

  3. A minimum of 1-3 yearsâ€™ professional experience, preferably in the consulting industry, or technical program equivalent
  4. Demonstrated abilities in use of ESRI GIS software (ArcMap, ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online)
  5. Report writing, organization and interpersonal skills
  6. Versatile, adaptable, and willing to conduct a variety of tasks  
Experience:
  1. Proficient in data compilation, relational database design, and extract, transform, and load (ETL) processes
  2. Designing custom data collection tools and models with automated reports
  3. Using statistics and machine learning principles to manipulate data and present results from large datasets
  4. Understanding of spatial analysis, spatial statistics, remote sensing and working knowledge of ESRI analysis tools (Network Analyst, Spatial Analyst, 3D Analyst)
  5. Development of mobile applications (Survey123, Collector, Field Maps) and ArcGIS Online web applications
  6. Demonstrated abilities in multidisciplinary project teamwork and coordination
  7. Proficient in the writing of technical reports
  8. Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication, and organizational skills    
  9. Working knowledge of the following programs and programming languages would be considered an asset: AutoCAD, Power BI, Tableau, CityEngine, Python, ArcPy, JavaScript, and Arcade

description:
Job Description

Are you looking to grow your career as a Mechanic or Technician? Do you have experience with engine repair or electrical troubleshooting? Do you dream of a great career and job-security with a well- established company? Come Join Our Team as a Repair Technician. Under the direction of the Branch Manager, the Repair Technician repairs, services and maintains engine driven Welders and Generators and ensures a safe working environment.

What equipment will you be repairing and working on?
This would include, but not be limited to:
● MIG, TIG, and STICK Welders
● Diesel &Natural Gas Generators
● Wire Feeders
● Welding Positioners
● And other Welding related equipment!

Preferred Qualifications/Experience:
● Ability to read and understand electrical wiring diagrams and schematics.
● 1-3+ years of experience troubleshooting and repairing electrical equipment.
● 1-3+ years of experience troubleshooting and repairing Diesel/Natural Gas engines.
● Working knowledge of positioning equipment, welding application and equipment is an asset.
● Post-secondary education equivalent to a one year Technical College or equivalent is an asset.
● Must have a valid Driver’s License.

Essential Duties:

● Ensures a safe work environment by following Airgas/Red-D-Arc’s health and safety guidelines.
● Repairs, refurbishes, and conducts preventative maintenance on all Electric and Engine Drives.
● Assembles electric, diesel, gas, and propane equipment for rental. Tests and calibrates machines to see if they are functional for rent or sale.
● Operates a forklift, pallet jack or other necessary equipment to stock required parts in the shop.
● Prepares and completes paperwork for all machine repairs.
● Occasionally required to service equipment and customers off-site.
● Assists with parts and equipment inventories, as well as rental agreement paperwork.
● Arranges freight and transportation.
● Maintains communication with all branch personnel.

Required Knowledge/Skills:
● Computer skills to produce effective spreadsheets, reports, documents and presentations, as required. Knowledge of MS Office applications.
● Ability to make critical decisions while following company procedures.
● Ability to effectively build relationships with customers and co-workers.
● Adaptable to set and prioritize work with varying exceptions.
● Ability to work with a wide variety of people with different personalities and backgrounds.
● Communicates with clarity, verbally in one on one or group situations, and over the telephone.

About Red-D-Arc:
Red-D-Arc Welderentals™ an Airgas company rents and leases welders, welding positioners, welding- related equipment, and electric power generators - anywhere in the world. Our rental welders, positioners and specialty products have been engineered and built to provide Extreme-Duty™ performance and reliability in even the harshest environments, and are available through over 70 Red-D-Arc Service
Centers, strategically located throughout the United States, Canada, Mexico, the United Kingdom, France, the Netherlands, Germany, and the UAE, as well as through strategic alliances in the Middle East, Spain, Italy, Croatia, Kazakhstan, Australia, the Caribbean, and Colombia.



Qualifications

We will accommodate the needs of applicants under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) throughout all stages of the recruitment and selections process. Applicants are required to provide their accommodation needs in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. Please advise the Human Resources Department to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.

description:
Metalumen is looking for a Technician – Manufacturing Support to be the “right hand” for our Manufacturing Engineering Manager.

About Metalumen

Metalumen Manufacturing is a family-owned company located in Guelph Ontario that has been in the business of designing, engineering and manufacturing lighting solutions since 1977. Many of our products are engineered to meet customer-specific needs and are up to 97% recyclable. We are committed to a culture based on communication, collaboration, product excellence and on-time delivery, as well as customer and agent satisfaction.

By applying for this position, you may have the chance to work as part of our team. We are constantly striving to improve our processes to provide the best for our employees.

About the position

Are you the type of person who excels at managing their own workload while at the same time remains in sync with the varied demands of your customer? Do you enjoy applying your own unique blend of formal training and hands-on experience in support of others? In addition to your practical skills do you also have a creative side that welcomes the opportunity to participate in developing new and exciting manufacturing solutions? If the answer is yes then Metalumen Manufacturing is actively seeking your positive, motivated and hardworking self to deliver effective and long-lasting solutions for our mutual success.

Main Duties

  • Maintain production equipment and building facilities in a safe and structured manner through the performance of regularly scheduled preventative maintenance
  • Spot welding
  • Identify, troubleshoot and resolve equipment issues
  • Support the installation and commissioning of new equipment and production processes
  • Proactively work to improve equipment uptime and reliability.
  • Support specific production processes as called upon
  • Fabricate jigs and fixtures when needed
  • Work to ensure regulatory compliance in regards to pre-start health and safety reviews as well as third party compliance audits
  • Support the H&S committee
  • Other duties as assigned


Requirements

  • Certificate of qualification as a Maintenance Mechanic, Millwright or similarly related trade with the requisite experience.
  • 5-10 years working in a manufacturing environment
  • Computer knowledge- email, computerized maintenance systems, CAD, MS Office etc.
  • Hands on knowledge of sheet metal fabrication equipment such as shears, turret presses, CNC lasers, brake presses, punches, etc.
  • Experience in automated CNC machinery and Robotics (ABB, Fanuc) preferred
  • Hands on working knowledge of, multi -stage powder painting systems, and infrared curing ovens is a definite asset
  • Critical thinking, troubleshooting, teamwork, oragnization, time management, creative, positive outlook, flexiblw, reliable, consistent

Benefits

  • Health and Dental after probationary period – 3 months
  • Pension Plan after one year of employment

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code, Metalumen is committed to providing inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Please notify Human Resources of any accommodations you may require.

description:

When you join the City of Guelph, you join a team of 2000 full and part-time employees who deliver services the community relies on every day. Together, we are bringing to life Guelph’s vision of an inclusive, connected, and prosperous city where we look after each other and our environment.

Our corporate values are integrity, service, inclusion, wellness, and learning. Guelph is consistently ranked as one of the best places in Canada to live, work, and play—all good reasons to consider a career in this beautiful city.

Job Summary

Resumes are being accepted for the temporary (1 year contract) position of GIS Analyst within the Information Technology department. Geographic Information Systems (GIS) is based within the Information Technology Department of Corporate Services. The mandate of GIS services is to provide leadership and support to City departments enabling them to provide better service to the public through GIS technology services and innovation. The GIS Analyst role will assist in the implementation of key GIS initiatives at the City of Guelph. The successful candidate will analyze current business processes and form an integral part of a team that re-engineers these processes to gain efficiencies and best utilize technologies. The successful candidate will perform all aspects of business analysis of GIS and related systems with a focus on quality customer service and continuous improvement processes. Guided by the goals and objectives of the City of Guelph Corporate Strategic Plan and committed to the Corporate Values of integrity, service, inclusion, wellness and learning, the candidate will aid in the achievement of the Community Vision for an inclusive, connected, prosperous city.

 

Your role

 

  • Collaboratively evolve large corporate spatial databases and applications to serve City requirements.
  • Develop-re-engineer GIS related policies, standards, procedures and strategies. 
  • Responsible for spatial analysis and interpretation on specific projects.
  • Maintain customized and third-party spatial applications and add-ons.
  • Manage GIS-related integrated systems projects.
  • Manage requirements with appropriate change management techniques, revision maintenance, security and overall system infrastructure.
  • Utilize industry best practices to ensure business continuity and continual improvement of corporate information systems.
  • Analyze and/or administer application interfaces, convert spatial data to different formats when required.
  • Work with other Business System Analysts to document, re-engineer and implement streamlined business processes and optimize corporate workflow.
  • Work in conjunction with other technical staff to isolate, troubleshoot, resolve problems and administer corporate applications.
  • Provide leadership and guidance to team members.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

 

Qualifications

  • Considerable experience related to the duties listed above, normally acquired through the completion of a university degree in Computer Science, Business, Geomatics, GIS Environmental Management or a related discipline and considerable experience supporting GIS and related systems in a medium to large sized corporate environment, preferably in a municipal setting. Candidates with an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
  • Experience working with ESRI’s ArcGIS software suite (ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Online)
  • Familiarity with FME from Safe Software for ETL processing.
  • Experience working with Oracle and SQL Server databases.
  • Experience in business analysis, business process re-engineering and managing IT related projects.
  • Experience in interface support, design, analysis and programming.
  • Must possess a valid class G drivers’ licence with a good driving record and access to a vehicle.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate with all levels of staff, stakeholders and external vendors.
  • Ability to manage a workload where priorities are constantly changing and work in an environment with a high rate of technological change.
  • Knowledge of land information requirements, field data collection systems and relevant municipal processes and policies.
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (e.g. Word, Excel, Power Point and Access) and Microsoft Project Management software.
  • A firm understanding of database, networking and system administration concepts.
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills.
  • Excellent customer and client support skills with the ability to work independently and within a team environment.
  • Certified geographic information systems professional (GISP) designation would be considered an asset.
  • Experience in the use of Eclipse PPM or other project management software would be an asset.

In accordance with the City of Guelph’s employment practices, new employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire, subject to accommodations required in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code.

$87,200 - $109,000

- Ongoing temporary position that has great potential to become permanent
- Monday to Friday morning shifts, with potential for overtime
- Very competitive pay at $25 to $27 to start, paid weekly.

- Positive working environment with a very friendly and motivated team

- Troubleshoot, repair, and modify equipment to maintain workplace safety and production efficiency
- Generate parts list and labour time estimates for maintenance and repairs
- Maintain repair records




Qualifications
- Experience working on hydraulic, pneumatic, and electrical maintenance and repairs
- Ability to read and interpret schematic diagrams
- Must be organized and detail-oriented

- Must have your own transportation, as public transport is not available

title: Technician - Manufacturing Support
description:
Metalumen is looking for a Technician – Manufacturing Support to be the “right hand” for our Manufacturing Engineering Manager.

About Metalumen

Metalumen Manufacturing is a family-owned company located in Guelph Ontario that has been in the business of designing, engineering and manufacturing lighting solutions since 1977. Many of our products are engineered to meet customer-specific needs and are up to 97% recyclable. We are committed to a culture based on communication, collaboration, product excellence and on-time delivery, as well as customer and agent satisfaction.

By applying for this position, you may have the chance to work as part of our team. We are constantly striving to improve our processes to provide the best for our employees.

About the position

Are you the type of person who excels at managing their own workload while at the same time remains in sync with the varied demands of your customer? Do you enjoy applying your own unique blend of formal training and hands-on experience in support of others? In addition to your practical skills do you also have a creative side that welcomes the opportunity to participate in developing new and exciting manufacturing solutions? If the answer is yes then Metalumen Manufacturing is actively seeking your positive, motivated and hardworking self to deliver effective and long-lasting solutions for our mutual success.

Main Duties

  • Maintain production equipment and building facilities in a safe and structured manner through the performance of regularly scheduled preventative maintenance 
  • Spot welding
  • Identify, troubleshoot and resolve equipment issues
  • Support the installation and commissioning of new equipment and production processes
  • Proactively work to improve equipment uptime and reliability. 
  • Support specific production processes as called upon
  • Fabricate jigs and fixtures when needed
  • Work to ensure regulatory compliance in regards to pre-start health and safety reviews as well as third party compliance audits
  • Support the H&S committee

  • 5-10 years working in a manufacturing environment
  • Computer knowledge- email, computerized maintenance systems, CAD, MS Office etc.
  • Hands on knowledge of sheet metal fabrication equipment such as shears, turret presses, CNC lasers, brake presses, punches, etc.
  • Experience in automated CNC machinery and Robotics (ABB, Fanuc) preferred
  • Hands on working knowledge of, multi -stage powder painting systems, and infrared curing ovens is a definite asset
  • Critical thinking, troubleshooting, teamwork, oragnization, time management, creative, positive outlook, flexiblw, reliable, consistent

Benefits

  • Health and Dental after probationary period – 3 months
  • Pension Plan after one year of employment

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code, Metalumen is committed to providing inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Please notify Human Resources of any accommodations you may require.
